This may be worth trying - Press CTRL ALT F1 to get to a login prompt and login
Then sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.master
This copies your xorg.conf so we can always put it back later

I'm sending you a private irc - can you see it (If you're using xchat-gnome it'll be on the left below #ubuntu)
CTRL ALT F1 and login then 'sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etx/X11/xorg.conf.master' without the quotes

Now edit the file using nano - type 'sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf' (again no quotes) and you will get in a text editor.  Look for a section that says Section Device followed by Identifier and the name of your Graphics card
Change the driver line in this section from whatever it is now to vesa
Save it by hitting CTRL-O then CTRL-X
if it doesn't work then back to the terminal with CTRL-ALT-F1 and then "cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf.master xorg.conf" again no quotes!
Capital X in the X11
Make sure you have copied down all the steps - particularly the one about how to put the original file back!
